meanings.definition: To fill with an excessive number of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The small classroom will overcrowd quickly with all the students.
meanings.sent2: The stadium will overcrowd during the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The bus stop will overcrowd with passengers waiting for the delayed bus.
meanings.sent4: Her mind started to overcrowd with worries and doubts.
meanings.sent5: The tiny boat began to overcrowd with too many passengers, causing it to tip over.

meanings.definition: To cause to be excessively crowded.
meanings.sent1: Please do not overcrowd the elevator; it has a weight limit.
meanings.sent2: The event organizers did not want to overcrowd the venue.
meanings.sent3: The fridge will overcrowd if you keep adding more food without organizing it.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule tends to overcrowd with meetings and appointments.
meanings.sent5: The city streets will overcrowd with cars during rush hour traffic.
